titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Amersfort Athletic Club constitution and bylaws 1973.177
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 14:20:36 +0000.

did.unittitle: Amersfort Athletic Club constitution and bylaws
did.abstract: Constitution and bylaws of the Amersfort Athletic Club, with member signatures included on the final page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Amersfort Athletic Club constitution and bylaws, 1973.177, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Amersfort Athletic Club was founded in Brooklyn in 1887 with the purpose of encouraging amateur athletic competition and social interaction among its members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Constitution and bylaws of the Amersfort Athletic Club, with member signatures included on the final page.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Garrit S.K. Remsen, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

controlaccess.subject: Athletic clubs -- New York (State) -- Kings County
